com.samsung.openscp

Class SecurityDomainSession

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samsung.openscp.SecurityDomainSession
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class SecurityDomainSession
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    Off-card entity communication (OCE) session with the security domain (SD, smart card)

      • authenticate

        public void authenticate(ScpKeyParams keyParams,
                         ScpMode mode)
                  throws BadResponseException,
                         ApduException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Initialize SCP and authenticate the session. SCP11b does not authenticate the off-card entity, and will not allow the usage of commands which require such authentication.
        Throws:
        BadResponseException
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException

      • getData

        public byte[] getData(short tag,
                      @Nullable
                      byte[] data)
               throws ApduException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Execute GET DATA command
        Parameters:
        tag - data object tag to read
        data - CAPDU data
        Returns:
        RAPDU data
        Throws:
        ApduException - in case if received error in APDU response
        java.io.IOException - in case of connection and communication error

                                     java.io.IOException,
                                     BadResponseException
        Retrieve card recognition data from the smart card
        Returns:
        card recognition data bytes
        Throws:
        ApduException - in case if received error in APDU response
        java.io.IOException - in case of connection and communication error
        BadResponseException - if the TLV tag differs from expectedTag

      • getCertificateBundle

        public java.util.List<ScpCertificate> getCertificateBundle(KeyRef keyRef)
                                                    throws ApduException,
                                                           java.io.IOException,
                                                           java.security.cert.CertificateException,
                                                           BadResponseException
        Retrieve an SCP11 Certificate Store from smart card using the GET DATA (Certificate Store) command
        Parameters:
        keyRef - key reference to the SK.SD.ECKA
        Returns:
        parsed certificates list
        Throws:
        ApduException - in case if received error in APDU response
        java.io.IOException - in case of connection and communication error
        java.security.cert.CertificateException - in case of certificate parsing failure
        BadResponseException - in case of TLV parsing failure

      • getSupportedCaIdentifiers

        public java.util.Map<KeyRef,byte[]> getSupportedCaIdentifiers(boolean kloc,
                                                              boolean klcc)
                                                       throws ApduException,
                                                              java.io.IOException
        Retrieve supported CA identifiers from smart card using the GET DATA (Supported CA Identifiers) command
        Parameters:
        kloc - retrieve supported Key Loading OCE Certificates
        klcc - retrieve supported Key Loading Card Certificates
        Returns:
        parsed CA identifiers
        Throws:
        ApduException - in case if received error in APDU response
        java.io.IOException - in case of connection and communication error

      • storeData

        public void storeData(byte[] data)
               throws ApduException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Execute the STORE DATA command
        Parameters:
        data - data to store on the smart card
        Throws:
        ApduException - in case if received error in APDU response
        java.io.IOException - in case of connection and communication error

      • storeCertificateBundle

        public void storeCertificateBundle(KeyRef keyRef,
                                   java.util.List<java.security.cert.X509Certificate> certificates)
                            throws ApduException,
                                   java.io.IOException
        Store the certificate chain for a given key using the STORE DATA (Certificate Store) command

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        Certificates should be in order, with the leaf certificate last.

        Parameters:
        keyRef - a reference to the key for which to store the certificates
        certificates - the certificates to store
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException

      • storeAllowlist

        public void storeAllowlist(KeyRef keyRef,
                           java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> serials)
                    throws ApduException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Store which certificate serial numbers that can be used for a given key using the STORE DATA (Allowlist) command

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        If no allowlist is stored, any certificate signed by the CA can be used.

        NOTE: Use for SCP11a

        Parameters:
        keyRef - a reference to the key for which to store the allowlist
        serials - the list of serial numbers to store
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException

      • storeAllowlist

        public void storeAllowlist(KeyRef keyRef,
                           java.util.List<java.math.BigInteger> serials,
                           java.lang.Integer allowlistCounter)
                    throws ApduException,
                           java.io.IOException
        Store which certificate serial numbers that can be used for a given key using the STORE DATA (Allowlist) command

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        If no allowlist is stored, any certificate signed by the CA can be used.

        NOTE: Use for SCP11c

        Parameters:
        keyRef - a reference to the key for which to store the allowlist
        serials - the list of serial numbers to store
        allowlistCounter - SD allowlist counter - positive integer up to 32767
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException

      • storeCaIssuer

        public void storeCaIssuer(KeyRef keyRef,
                          byte[] ski)
                   throws ApduException,
                          java.io.IOException
        Store the SKI (Subject Key Identifier) for the CA of a given key using the STORE DATA (CA Identifier) command

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        Parameters:
        keyRef - a reference to the key for which to store the CA issuer
        ski - the Subject Key Identifier to store
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException

      • deleteKey

        public void deleteKey(KeyRef keyRef,
                      boolean deleteLast)
               throws ApduException,
                      java.io.IOException
        Delete one (or more) keys.

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        All keys matching the given KID and/or KVN will be deleted (0 is treated as a wildcard).

        To delete the final key you must set deleteLast = true.

        Parameters:
        keyRef - a reference to the key to delete
        deleteLast - must be true if deleting the final key, false otherwise
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException

      • generateEcKey

        public PublicKeyValues.Ec generateEcKey(KeyRef keyRef,
                                        int replaceKvn)
                                 throws ApduException,
                                        java.io.IOException,
                                        BadResponseException
        Generate a new SCP11 key.

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        Parameters:
        keyRef - the KID-KVN pair to assign the new key
        replaceKvn - 0 to generate a new keypair, non-zero to replace an existing KVN
        Returns:
        the public key from the generated key pair
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException
        BadResponseException

      • putKey

        public void putKey(KeyRef keyRef,
                   StaticKeys keys,
                   int replaceKvn)
            throws ApduException,
                   java.io.IOException,
                   BadResponseException
        Imports an SCP03 key set.

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        Parameters:
        keyRef - the KID-KVN pair to assign the new key set, KID must be 1
        keys - the key material to import
        replaceKvn - 0 to generate a new keypair, non-zero to replace an existing KVN
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException
        BadResponseException

      • putKey

        public void putKey(KeyRef keyRef,
                   PrivateKeyValues secretKey,
                   int replaceKvn)
            throws ApduException,
                   java.io.IOException,
                   BadResponseException
        Imports a secret key for SCP11.

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        Parameters:
        keyRef - the KID-KVN pair to assign the new secret key, KID must be 0x11, 0x13, or 0x15
        secretKey - a private EC key used to authenticate the SD
        replaceKvn - 0 to generate a new keypair, non-zero to replace an existing KVN
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException
        BadResponseException

      • putKey

        public void putKey(KeyRef keyRef,
                   PublicKeyValues publicKey,
                   int replaceKvn)
            throws ApduException,
                   java.io.IOException,
                   BadResponseException
        Imports a public key for authentication of the off-card entity for SCP11a/c.

        Requires off-card entity verification.

        Parameters:
        keyRef - the KID-KVN pair to assign the new public key
        publicKey - a public EC key used as CA to authenticate the off-card entity
        replaceKvn - 0 to generate a new keypair, non-zero to replace an existing KVN
        Throws:
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException
        BadResponseException

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws BadResponseException,
                  ApduException,
                  java.io.IOException
        Perform a factory reset of the Security Domain.

        This will remove all keys and associated data, as well as restore the default SCP03 static keys, and generate a new (attestable) SCP11b key.

        Throws:
        BadResponseException
        ApduException
        java.io.IOException

      • sendAndReceive

        public byte[] sendAndReceive(Apdu apdu)
                      throws ApduException,
                             java.io.IOException
        Send Command APDU to the smart card, receives the Response APDU payload.

        NOTE: SW is not included to returned data

        Parameters:
        apdu - Command APDU to send
        Returns:
        Response APDU data payload
        Throws:
        ApduException - in case if received error in APDU response
        java.io.IOException - in case of connection and communication error

      • sendAndReceiveApdu

        public byte[] sendAndReceiveApdu(Apdu apdu)
                          throws ApduException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Send Command APDU to the smart card, receives the raw Response APDU
        Parameters:
        apdu - Command APDU to send
        Returns:
        Response APDU raw data including SW bytes
        Throws:
        ApduException - in case if received error in APDU response
        java.io.IOException - in case of connection and communication error
